intro: Pentas pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered pentas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, adding to its visual appeal.
